p: Here for the thermodynamic component ( δTH), circulation ( u) is fixed at the CTRL climatological value, thus representing changes due to specific humidity ( q); and for the dynamic component ( δ D Y), specific humidity ( q) is fixed at the CTRL climatological value, thus representing changes due to circulation ( u). The quadratic term involving covariances of departures from climatological values of u and q is small compared to δTH and δDY (Figure S5).
